autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: in achieving my goals and desires
autonomy.question: Did I take for granted God's guidance in my life, forgetting to acknowledge His hand at work in achieving my goals and desires?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: in an action that would be considered sinful
scandal.question: Did you attempt to persuade someone else to engage in an action that would be considered sinful?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my own wrongdoing, stubbornly clinging to a particular sin?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

extracted_data_phrases: in refusing to acknowledge my wrongdoing , stubbornly holding on to guilt without seeking forgiveness
impenitence.question: Have I persisted in refusing to acknowledge my wrongdoing, stubbornly holding on to guilt without seeking forgiveness?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I refused to acknowledge my own wrongdoing, stubbornly holding onto pride rather than embracing God's mercy?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

blasphemy.question: Did you, in conversation or public speaking, swear to God?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

extracted_data_phrases: during a heated conversation or disagreement with someone
blasphemy.question: Did you swear to God in anger, frustration, or disrespect during a heated conversation or disagreement with someone?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of serious personal sin or unresolved conflicts
of serious personal sin or unresolved conflicts
blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of serious personal sin or unresolved conflicts?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of grave interior sin
blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of grave interior sin, particularly one that involves a deliberate turning away from God's will and laws?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to guide my decisions when engaging in community service or volunteering, potentially leading me to prioritize my own interests over serving others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.question: Did I allow a pursuit of control over my relationships and interactions to influence my decisions, potentially causing me to prioritize my own interests above those of others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulation of wealth and possessions a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Have I made the accumulation of money and possessions a driving force in my life, potentially replacing trust in God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through unjust treatment , harassment , or discrimination
oppression.question: Did I mistreat others through unjust treatment, harassment, or discrimination in any form?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Have I intentionally or through thoughtless actions mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: of my own struggles or hardships
envy.question: Have I secretly wished others to experience some of my own struggles or hardships, thereby diminishing their blessings in my eyes?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that led me to feel resentful or dissatisfied
envy.question: Have I secretly compared my own blessings to those of others in a way that led me to feel resentful or dissatisfied?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or hurtful language, violating their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control when speaking to others, using language that was unbecoming of your dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and use words that were hurtful to others, particularly those in positions of authority or with whom I have a close relationship?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, perhaps neglecting my physical and spiritual well-being in doing so?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

anger.question: Have I held onto feelings of anger, rather than seeking reconciliation in relationships that bring me joy?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
